author: Simon Robb for Metro.co.uk
title: Woman bedridden for 35 years in agony after growing up in black mould-infested home
text:
Dana Anhalt has had health problems since she was 16 (Picture: Caters News) A woman has been left bed ridden and in constant pain for 35 years because of black mould in her childhood home. 
Dana Anhalt has suffered from meningitis, constant sinus infections, repeated bouts of strep, migraines and hormonal trouble since she was 16.
Man makes miniature hats to make his toad friend look fancy She later developed severe allergies and dropped down to 70lbs in her 20s and 30s.
Last year the 37-year-old, from Huntington, New York, was finally diagnosed with Lyme disease, but despite treatment her health continued to decline.
It was only when the family noticed a musty smell from their basement they realised their apartment was infested with poisonous black mould.
Last year doctors diagnosed her with Lyme disease (Picture: Caters News) Inhaling or touching mould spores can cause an allergic reaction, asthma and sometime more serious health problems, according to the NHS .
Doctors immediately ordered Dana to move out and leave all her belongings behind – which could also be contaminated.
World's oldest skier, 106, credits high quality liquor for his longevity Now the family have launched a GoFundMe page to help with the big move.
Dana said: ‘I’ve spent all 37 years of my life slowly being poisoned from the inside out.
‘The genetic testing was difficult to look at but it was also one of the most of vindicating things I’ve ever seen. Suddenly, decades of my experience made sense.’
Black mould was found in the family home basement (Picture: Caters News) The writer said she was diagnosed with Fibromyalgia (condition that causes widespread pain) after her mother died in 2012, but did not respond to treatments.
Man confesses to dousing a homeless man in petrol and setting him alight She said: ‘By 2011 I was almost entirely bed bound, and by 2012 I was ravaged with muscle and joint pain so severe that I often vomited from the intensity.
‘I was trapped in a body that could not articulate what I was going through or seek comfort in connection with others.’
She suffers with severe food allergies and also cannot take many types of pain medication, Dana has no relief from the agony.
Dana has started a GoFuneMe page to fund a new apartment (Picture: Caters News) Then, in 2016 it was discovered there was a rampant black mould infestation which had been there since a flood when Dana was a child.
Heartbroken baby monkey weeps as it clings to dead mother's body ‘We rushed to find a new apartment and we had to leave all of our belongings, everything I had collected over the years, it was devastating,’ she said.
Now the family have managed to raise more than $30,000 (£25,000) of the $100,000 (£82,000) target to help pay for new furniture as well as ongoing medical costs.
Studying psychology, Dana hopes to be an advocate for people with complex illnesses.
